pantinori wrote:

> Is there a way to specify in the ANT build.xml target for junit, that
> certain test methods in a TestCase class should be executed.  I have
> several test methods in a TestCase that need to be executed several
> times and in the proper order.  I was looking at the ANT
> documentation on <batchtests> and the fileset node can only indicate
> classes, not a list of tests that should go into a TestSuite.

I'm not aware of a dynamic way of achieving this, unfortunately.

Of course, you could write a TestSuite that includes the test methods of
interest:

public class MySuite extends TestCase {

    public static Test suite() {
        TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
        suite.addTest(new TestCase1("testSomething"));
        suite.addTest(new TestCase2("testSomething"));
        suite.addTest(new TestCase3("testSomething"));
        ...
        return suite;
    }

But you probably already thought of that...
